page.title: 04Farming around Medburn
page.content: A local lecturer in Agricultural matters gave us a talk about farming. We walked along a public footpath across fields from Medburn to Darras Hall,looking at what was growing.A lot of the land was water-logged;machines were digging drainage channels to lay pipes.Most grazing land is being improved for cereal crops. "To-day the class went on a walk. When we got to{Medburn}some of the mums went home. We saw a horse; Nola said it was called Buttercup.We found a post-box which had Edward V11 on it. We went past Donkins' Farm. The field was all dug up and some men were there with bulldozers.On our drive around to {Medburn}we only saw a few cows; we think it was{barley}growing in the fields we passed." Dawn,age 8yrs.
